marketNews.title: BI Rate Cut to 5%, Outside Expectations
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (20 August 2025) cut the BI Rate by 25 basis points to a level of 5%, contrary to the consensus expectation of no change. The deposit facility and lending facility were also each cut by 25 basis points to 4.25% and 5.75% respectively. With this decision, BI has reduced the BI Rate by a total of 100 basis points since the beginning of 2025.

Governor Perry Warjiyo said the move was taken to stimulate economic growth while the rupiah exchange rate remains stable and inflation is projected to stay low within the target range of 1.5-3.5%. Perry added that the central bank will continue to monitor the possibility of further rate cuts to support higher economic growth.

Bloomberg reported that the decision to cut rates for the second consecutive month amid 2Q25 economic growth that exceeded expectations indicates that Bank Indonesia is steering its policy closer to the government’s target, where the 2026 State Budget (RAPBN 2026) aims for a 5.4% YoY economic growth. This target is higher than the 1H25 realization of 4.99% YoY and the 2025 budget outlook of around 4.7-5% YoY.

Perry stated that the central bank now forecasts Indonesia’s 2025 economic growth at 5.1% YoY, above the midpoint of the central bank’s projection range of 4.6-5.4% YoY. This marks a change in wording compared with the July 2025 meeting when Perry only mentioned the growth range.

In response to the announcement, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed up 1.03% on Wednesday, while the 10-year government bond yield was relatively flat at 6.402% (down 1 basis point) and the rupiah weakened 0.15% to 16,270 per US dollar.

Key Takeaway

The trend of rate cuts and expectations of accelerated government spending could boost economic growth from the second half of 2025. Bank Indonesia also expects the US Federal Reserve to cut rates two more times this year, each by 25 basis points, providing room for further BI Rate reductions.

Sectorally, financial services (+1.18%) and property (+2.56%), which are sensitive to interest-rate movements, gained on the trading day.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Bank Indonesia recorded that bank credit growth slowed to +7.03% YoY in the first seven months of 2025 (vs. +7.77% YoY in 1H25), marking the weakest growth since March 2022 and below the 2025 target that was downgraded by Bank Indonesia to a range of +8-11% YoY. Investment credit grew +12.42% YoY, consumption credit +8.11% YoY, and working-capital credit +3.08% YoY. Sharia financing in 1H25 grew +8.31% YoY and MSME credit growth was +1.82% YoY.

2. The Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Association, Edy Suyanto, told Bisnis on Tuesday (19 August) that members could potentially halt 50% of production capacity if gas suppliers continue to limit gas usage with a specific earth-gas base tariff (HGBT) at 48% and impose a surcharge of USD 17.8 per MMBtu. This surcharge is about 20% higher than the regasification gas price of USD 14.8 per MMBtu. Previously, Edy explained that the ceramic industry in West Java saw gas allocation drop from 60% to 48% due to restrictions imposed by Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) from 13-31 August 2025.

tickerNews.title: PACK rights issue to fund nickel mining stake acquisition
tickerNews.content: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama plans a rights issue in the form of mandatory convertible bonds (OWK) that can be converted into up to 35 billion new shares, causing dilution up to 95.58%. PT Eco Energi Perkasa, the controlling shareholder, will act as standby buyer to guarantee purchase of remaining shares and/or other equity effects not exercised by shareholders. The proceeds will be used to acquire minority stakes in two nickel mining companies – 30 % of PT Konutara Sejati and 34.5 % of PT Karyatama Konawe Utara – from non-affiliated company Denway Development Limited, valued at a total of IDR 2.7 trillion. Details on schedule and pricing of the OWK have not been announced, and the plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 25 September 2025.

tickerNews.title: SCMA share purchase by EMTK
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), the controlling shareholder of Surya Citra Media, purchased approximately 230.7 million shares of SCMA at an average price of IDR 236 per share between 5-15 August 2025. The total transaction value reached IDR 54.5 billion. After the transaction, EMTK’s direct ownership in SCMA increased from 66.11 % to 66.43 %.

tickerNews.title: BBCA clarification on alleged 2002 share purchase
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia issued a clarification to the IDX denying allegations of legal violations in the purchase of a 51 % stake in BBCA worth IDR 5 trillion by the FarIndo consortium in 2002. BBCA explained that the transaction value referred to the market price of BBCA on the IDX at the time of the strategic private placement, around IDR 10 trillion. BBCA emphasized that the transaction was conducted through a tender process overseen by the government via the National Banking Rehabilitation Agency. The clarification came after a University of Gadjah Mada economist, Sasmito Hadinegoro, suggested possible manipulation in the 51 % BBCA transaction, noting that it was below the company's book value of IDR 117 trillion at that time. Separately, Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani on Tuesday (19 /8) denied rumors that his company planned to acquire a majority stake in BBCA.

tickerNews.title: WIFI share purchase by PT Investasi Sukses Bersama
tickerNews.content: PT Investasi Sukses Bersama, the controlling shareholder of Solusi Sinergi Digital, purchased approximately 10.7 million shares of WIFI at an average price of IDR 3,000 per share on 19 August 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 32.2 billion. After the transaction, PT Investasi Sukses Bersama’s direct ownership in WIFI rose from 54.22 % to 54.42 %.

tickerNews.title: RATU share sale by RAJA
tickerNews.content: Raharja Energi Cepu’s controlling shareholder, Rukun Raharja (RAJA), sold 10 million shares of RATU at an average price of IDR 6,000 per share on 14 August 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 60 billion and was intended for divestment. After the transaction, RAJA’s direct ownership in RATU decreased from 69.996 % to 69.628 %.

tickerNews.title: ACES same-store sales contraction in July 2025
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia reported same-store sales growth (SSSG) of –2.7 % YoY in July 2025 (June 2025: –4.8 % YoY, July 2024: +4.6 % YoY). This resulted in a 7-month (Jan-Jul) SSSG contraction of –2.9 % YoY (7M24: +9.8 % YoY), below the 2025 target of over +1 % YoY. During 7M25, SSSG slowed across all regions: outside Java –0.9 % YoY, Java outside Jakarta –3.9 % YoY, and Jakarta –4.2 % YoY.

tickerNews.title: PTRO share purchases by Petrosea insiders
tickerNews.content: Three members of Petrosea’s board and management – Erwin Ciputra, Michael, and Kartika Hendrawan – each purchased shares of PTRO at an average price of IDR 3,956 per share on 19 August 2025. Erwin bought 400,000 shares, Michael 123,000 shares, and Kartika 50,000 shares, totaling approximately IDR 2.3 billion. After the purchases, Erwin’s ownership rose from 0.0858 % to 0.0898 %, Michael’s from 0.0193 % to 0.0206 %, and Kartika’s from 0.0167 % to 0.0172 %.

tickerNews.title: ELSA credit facility increase with BBNI
tickerNews.content: Elnusa announced that it has signed an agreement with Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) to increase the ceiling of its credit facility from USD 50 million with a 12-month tenor to USD 70 million with a 24-month tenor.

tickerNews.title: DOID coal asset purchase cancellation
tickerNews.content: BUMA International Group, through its subsidiary PT Bukit Makmur Internasional, announced that it received a notice from Peabody Energy Corporation (NYSE: BTU) that the purchase agreement for metallurgical coal assets (coking coal) from Anglo American (LON: AAL) was cancelled due to failure to reach a material adverse change agreement. Previously, in November 2024, DOID announced an agreement to purchase a 51 % stake in a metallurgical coal mine at Dawson Complex, Australia for USD 455 million from Peabody Energy. The transaction was part of Anglo American’s divestment of remaining metallurgical coal assets to Peabody, which will transfer Dawson Complex to PT Bukit Makmur Internasional after completing the transaction with Anglo American.

tickerNews.title: TIRT shift to marine transportation
tickerNews.content: Tirta Mahakam Resources plans to shift its core business from plywood manufacturing to marine transportation. To support this, the company intends to purchase ten tugboats and barges worth IDR 162.1 billion from an affiliated party. Funding will be sourced from a loan facility up to IDR 200 billion from PT Harita Jayaraya, the controlling shareholder. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 25 September 2025.

tickerNews.title: CBRE rights issue and vessel purchase
tickerNews.content: Cakra Buana Resources Energi intends to conduct a rights issue of up to 48 billion new shares, with proceeds to be used for partial debt repayment via mandatory convertible bonds, working capital, and capex for fleet expansion. The issue price has not been announced. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 25 September 2025. Previously, CBRE signed an agreement to purchase one pipe-laying and lifting vessel for USD 100 million (approximately IDR 1.6 trillion) to diversify into the offshore support vessel segment.
